news.headline: HUL Q3 FY25 Net Profit Rises 19% to ₹3,001 Crore
news.text: Hindustan Unilever Limited reported a 19% year-over-year increase in net profit, reaching ₹3,001 crore in Q3 FY25. This growth was primarily driven by a ₹509 crore gain from the divestment of its 'Pureit' water purifier business. Revenue grew by 2% to ₹15,195 crore, with flat underlying volume growth offset by a negative mix.

news.headline: HUL Acquires 90.5% Stake in Minimalist for ₹2,706 Crore
news.text: Hindustan Unilever has finalized its acquisition of a 90.5% stake in Uprising Science, the parent company of skincare brand Minimalist, for ₹2,706.44 crore. The deal, executed through primary infusion and secondary share purchase, awaits CCI approval. Analysts predict an 11% upside for HUL shares, with a consensus 'Buy' recommendation.

news.headline: HUL's Q4 Profit Misses Estimates Amid Weak Urban Demand
news.text: Hindustan Unilever reported a fourth-quarter net profit of ₹2,493 crore, narrowly missing analyst expectations of ₹2,498 crore. The company faced pressure from rising expenses and weakened urban demand, particularly for packaged foods and affordable personal care items, leading to a 30 basis point contraction in EBITDA margins to 23.1%.

news.headline: HUL Shares Drop to 8-Month Low on Margin Concerns
news.text: Hindustan Unilever's shares dropped by 3.5% on Thursday, reaching their lowest point since May, due to concerns over near-term margin pressure. The company's stock was the biggest decliner on the Nifty 50 index, which rose by 0.23% overall. This decline followed the company's forecast that its margins would be at the lower end of the 23%-24% range amidst rising costs for key commodities like palm oil and tea, and a slump in urban demand in November.
